newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Oct 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Oct 21.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Sales reduction cuts net profit of Saudi's industrial giant Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC) in first nine months of 1996. SABIC's net dropped 30 percent to 3.415 billion riyals.
- United Arab Emirates urges OPEC to defend reasonable oil prices.
- Saudi businessman Prince al-Waleed bin Talal studies plans to build new tourist sites on Red Sea coast.
- Saudi Arabian Fertiliser Company posts 508 million riyal net profits in first nine months of 1996.
- Bahrain Monetary Agency governor says banking sector in Bahrain is stable, no new rules to prevent movement of funds.
